alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Campbell; Knox; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:21PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Anderson, north central Knox, central Campbell and western Union Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 321 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jacksboro, or near La Follette, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clinton, La Follette, Jacksboro, Caryville, Rocky Top, Norris, Norris Dam State Park, Andersonville, Paulette and Big Ridge State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
